issue.title: Implement Production CI/CD Pipeline with GitHub Actions

milestone.title: Week 2-3 - Mobile App Launch
milestone.description: Mobile application development and app store submission

issue.body:
## User Story
As a DevOps engineer, I want an automated CI/CD pipeline that builds, tests, and deploys Claude Code applications with zero downtime so that we can ship features rapidly and reliably.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] **Multi-Platform Builds**: Automated builds for web, mobile (iOS/Android), and API services
- [ ] **Automated Testing**: Run full test suite including unit, integration, and E2E tests
- [ ] **Security Scanning**: Automated vulnerability scanning and dependency checks
- [ ] **Multi-Environment**: Deploy to staging automatically, production with approval
- [ ] **Zero Downtime**: Blue-green deployment with automatic rollback on failure
- [ ] **Monitoring Integration**: Deploy health checks and monitoring configuration
- [ ] **Mobile Deployment**: Automated app store builds and submission preparation

## Pipeline Architecture
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Code Push] --> B[GitHub Actions Trigger]
    B --> C[Multi-Platform Build]
    C --> D[Run Test Suite]
    D --> E[Security Scan]
    E --> F[Build Docker Images]
    F --> G[Deploy to Staging]
    G --> H[Integration Tests]
    H --> I{Manual Approval}
    I -->|Approved| J[Production Deploy]
    I -->|Rejected| K[Stop Pipeline]
    J --> L[Health Checks]
    L --> M{Health OK?}
    M -->|Yes| N[Complete]
    M -->|No| O[Auto Rollback]
```

## GitHub Actions Workflows

### Main Deployment Pipeline
```yaml
name: Production Deployment
on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        node-version: [18, 20]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ matrix.node-version }}
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
      - name: Run tests
        run: npm run test:ci
      - name: Run E2E tests
        run: npm run test:e2e
```

### Mobile Build Pipeline
```yaml
name: Mobile App Build
on:
  push:
    branches: [main, develop]
    paths: ['mobile-app/**']

jobs:
  build-ios:
    runs-on: macos-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Setup Xcode
        uses: maxim-lobanov/setup-xcode@v1
        with:
          xcode-version: latest-stable
      - name: Build iOS app
        run: |
          cd mobile-app/ios
          xcodebuild -workspace ClaudeCode.xcworkspace -scheme ClaudeCode -configuration Release
```

## Build Stages

### 1. Code Quality & Testing (15 minutes)
- **Linting**: ESLint, Prettier, TypeScript checks
- **Unit Tests**: Jest with coverage reporting (>80%)
- **Integration Tests**: API and component integration tests
- **Security Scan**: CodeQL, Snyk vulnerability scanning
- **Performance Tests**: Lighthouse CI for web performance

### 2. Multi-Platform Builds (20 minutes)
- **Web App**: Next.js production build with optimization
- **API Services**: Docker multi-stage builds with security scanning
- **Mobile Apps**: iOS and Android builds with code signing
- **Documentation**: Auto-generated API docs and guides

### 3. Staging Deployment (10 minutes)
- **Infrastructure**: Terraform apply for staging environment
- **Database Migrations**: Automated schema updates with rollback
- **Service Deployment**: Blue-green deployment with health checks
- **Integration Testing**: Automated tests against staging environment

### 4. Production Deployment (15 minutes)
- **Manual Approval**: Required approval from team leads
- **Production Deploy**: Zero-downtime blue-green deployment
- **Health Monitoring**: Automated health checks and metrics validation
- **Rollback**: Automatic rollback on failure detection

## Security Integration
```typescript
interface SecurityScans {
  dependency_check: {
    tool: 'Snyk' | 'npm audit';
    fail_on: 'high' | 'critical';
    exclude: string[];
  };
  static_analysis: {
    tool: 'CodeQL' | 'SonarQube';
    languages: ['javascript', 'typescript', 'python'];
    rules: 'security-extended';
  };
  container_scan: {
    tool: 'Trivy' | 'Clair';
    severity_threshold: 'HIGH';
    ignore_unfixed: boolean;
  };
}
```

## Environment Management
```yaml
# environments/staging.yml
environment:
  name: staging
  url: https://staging.claude-code.com
  protection_rules:
    required_reviewers: 1
    wait_timer: 0

# environments/production.yml
environment:
  name: production
  url: https://claude-code.com
  protection_rules:
    required_reviewers: 2
    wait_timer: 5
```

## Deployment Strategies

### Web Application
- **Platform**: Vercel with GitHub integration
- **Strategy**: Atomic deployments with instant rollback
- **CDN**: Automatic cache invalidation and purging
- **Monitoring**: Real-time performance and error monitoring

### API Services
- **Platform**: Railway or AWS ECS with load balancing
- **Strategy**: Blue-green deployment with health checks
- **Database**: Automated migrations with rollback capability
- **Scaling**: Horizontal auto-scaling based on CPU/memory usage

### Mobile Applications
- **iOS**: Automated build with TestFlight distribution
- **Android**: Google Play internal testing track
- **Code Push**: Over-the-air updates for React Native
- **Store Submission**: Automated store asset generation

## Quality Gates
```typescript
interface QualityGates {
  test_coverage: {
    minimum: 80;
    fail_build: true;
  };
  performance: {
    lighthouse_score: 90;
    bundle_size_limit: '500KB';
  };
  security: {
    max_vulnerabilities: 0;
    severity_threshold: 'HIGH';
  };
}
```

## Monitoring & Alerting
- **Build Status**: Slack notifications for build failures
- **Deployment Status**: Teams notifications for deployment events
- **Performance Alerts**: Automated alerts for performance degradation
- **Error Tracking**: Integration with Sentry for error monitoring

## Rollback Strategy
```typescript
interface RollbackPlan {
  trigger_conditions: [
    'health_check_failure',
    'error_rate_spike',
    'manual_trigger'
  ];
  rollback_steps: [
    'stop_new_traffic',
    'switch_to_previous_version',
    'verify_health',
    'notify_team'
  ];
  rollback_time: '< 2 minutes';
}
```

## Cache Management
- **CDN Cache**: Automatic cache invalidation on deployment
- **Application Cache**: Redis cache warming and invalidation
- **Browser Cache**: Cache-busting for static assets
- **API Cache**: Intelligent cache invalidation for API responses

## Performance Optimization
- [ ] **Parallel Builds**: Run builds in parallel where possible
- [ ] **Caching**: Aggressive caching of dependencies and build artifacts
- [ ] **Incremental Builds**: Only rebuild changed components
- [ ] **Resource Optimization**: Efficient resource allocation for builds

## Secrets Management
```yaml
# GitHub Secrets Configuration
secrets:
  CLAUDE_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.CLAUDE_API_KEY }}
  GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
  DOCKER_REGISTRY_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_REGISTRY_TOKEN }}
  VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
  RAILWAY_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.RAILWAY_TOKEN }}
  IOS_CERTIFICATE: ${{ secrets.IOS_CERTIFICATE }}
  ANDROID_KEYSTORE: ${{ secrets.ANDROID_KEYSTORE }}
```

## Estimated Effort
- **Story Points**: 16
- **Time Estimate**: 12-15 hours
- **Priority**: P1-high
- **Sprint**: Week 2

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Complete CI/CD pipeline operational for all platforms
- [ ] Automated testing and security scanning working
- [ ] Zero-downtime deployment verified
- [ ] Rollback procedures tested and functional
- [ ] Monitoring and alerting configured
- [ ] Documentation complete with runbooks

issue.title: Build Responsive Dashboard with Project Management

labels.name: P0-critical
labels.description: Critical priority - must complete in Week 1

milestone.title: Week 1 - Web Production Launch
milestone.description: Critical path for web application production deployment

issue.body:
## User Story
As a developer, I want a centralized dashboard where I can manage my projects, view recent activity, and quickly access my most important repositories and conversations.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] **Project Overview**: Grid/list view of all connected repositories and projects
- [ ] **Recent Activity**: Timeline of recent Claude interactions and file changes
- [ ] **Quick Actions**: Fast access to create new projects, open recent files
- [ ] **Statistics**: Usage metrics, token consumption, and productivity insights
- [ ] **Search**: Global search across projects, files, and conversation history
- [ ] **Responsive Design**: Optimized for desktop, tablet, and mobile browsers
- [ ] **Customization**: Personalized dashboard with draggable widgets

## Technical Requirements
- Use Next.js App Router with server-side rendering
- Implement lazy loading for performance with large project counts
- Add real-time updates using WebSocket integration
- Include accessibility features and keyboard shortcuts
- Support offline mode with cached data

## Implementation Details
```typescript
interface Dashboard {
  projects: Project[];
  recentActivity: Activity[];
  stats: UsageStats;
  quickActions: QuickAction[];
  widgets: Widget[];
  searchResults: SearchResult[];
  loading: boolean;
  error: string | null;
}

interface Project {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  repository: string;
  lastAccessed: Date;
  fileCount: number;
  conversationCount: number;
  status: 'active' | 'archived' | 'error';
}
```

## UI Components
- `DashboardGrid`: Main dashboard layout with responsive grid
- `ProjectCard`: Project summary card with key metrics and quick actions
- `ActivityFeed`: Real-time activity timeline with filtering
- `StatsWidget`: Usage statistics with charts and graphs
- `SearchBar`: Global search with autocomplete and filters
- `QuickActionPanel`: Floating action buttons for common tasks
- `WidgetContainer`: Draggable widget system for customization

## Features
- **Project Management**: Create, archive, and organize projects
- **Activity Tracking**: Monitor file edits, Claude conversations, and system events
- **Usage Analytics**: Track API usage, response times, and productivity metrics
- **Favorites**: Pin frequently used projects and files
- **Notifications**: In-app notifications for important events and updates
- **Export**: Export project data and conversation history

## Performance Requirements
- [ ] **Fast Loading**: Dashboard loads within 1.5 seconds
- [ ] **Smooth Animations**: 60fps animations for interactions and transitions
- [ ] **Efficient Updates**: Real-time updates without full page reloads
- [ ] **Memory Usage**: <100MB memory footprint with 50+ projects

## Data Management
- **Caching Strategy**: Cache project metadata and recent activity locally
- **Pagination**: Lazy load projects and activities with infinite scroll
- **Offline Support**: Show cached data when offline with sync indicators
- **Data Synchronization**: Real-time sync across browser tabs and devices

## Responsive Design
- [ ] **Desktop**: Full dashboard with sidebar and multiple columns
- [ ] **Tablet**: Collapsible sidebar with touch-optimized interactions
- [ ] **Mobile**: Stack layout with bottom navigation and gestures
- [ ] **Accessibility**: Screen reader support and keyboard navigation

## Widget System
```typescript
interface Widget {
  id: string;
  type: 'stats' | 'activity' | 'projects' | 'search' | 'custom';
  position: { x: number; y: number };
  size: { width: number; height: number };
  config: Record<string, any>;
  visible: boolean;
}
```

Available Widgets:
- **Usage Stats**: API usage, token consumption, cost tracking
- **Recent Projects**: Quick access to recently used projects
- **Activity Timeline**: Recent file changes and Claude interactions
- **File Search**: Search across all project files
- **Conversation History**: Recent Claude conversations
- **Performance Metrics**: Response times and system health

## Integration Points
- **GitHub API**: Fetch repository information and metadata
- **Claude API**: Usage statistics and conversation history
- **WebSocket**: Real-time activity updates
- **Analytics**: User behavior tracking (privacy-compliant)

## Security Considerations
- Secure API token storage and transmission
- User data privacy and GDPR compliance
- Input sanitization for search and filters
- Rate limiting for API calls and searches

## Testing Requirements
- [ ] **Unit Tests**: Test all dashboard components and logic
- [ ] **Integration Tests**: Test API integrations and data flow
- [ ] **Performance Tests**: Verify performance with large datasets
- [ ] **Accessibility Tests**: Screen reader and keyboard testing
- [ ] **Mobile Tests**: Touch interactions and responsive behavior

## SEO & Performance
- **Server-side Rendering**: Fast initial page load with Next.js
- **Meta Tags**: Proper meta tags for search engines
- **Core Web Vitals**: Optimize for Google's performance metrics
- **Progressive Enhancement**: Work without JavaScript enabled

## Analytics & Insights
- [ ] **Usage Patterns**: Track how users interact with dashboard features
- [ ] **Performance Monitoring**: Monitor page load times and errors
- [ ] **A/B Testing**: Test different dashboard layouts and features
- [ ] **User Feedback**: Collect feedback on dashboard usability

## Estimated Effort
- **Story Points**: 12
- **Time Estimate**: 9-11 hours
- **Priority**: P0-critical
- **Sprint**: Week 1

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Dashboard is fully functional with all core features
- [ ] Responsive design works on all device sizes
- [ ] Real-time updates working via WebSocket
- [ ] Performance requirements met
- [ ] Accessibility requirements satisfied
- [ ] All tests passing and code reviewed

issue.body:
## User Story
As a developer, I want secure GitHub authentication so that I can access my repositories and maintain persistent sessions across the Claude Code platform.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] **OAuth Flow**: Complete GitHub OAuth 2.0 integration with proper error handling
- [ ] **Token Management**: Secure storage and refresh of GitHub access tokens
- [ ] **Session Persistence**: Maintain user sessions across browser restarts
- [ ] **Permission Scopes**: Request appropriate GitHub permissions (repos, user)
- [ ] **Multi-account Support**: Support multiple GitHub accounts per user
- [ ] **Security**: Implement CSRF protection and secure token storage
- [ ] **Logout**: Complete logout with token revocation

## Technical Requirements
- Use NextAuth.js for authentication infrastructure
- Implement JWT tokens with secure httpOnly cookies
- Add rate limiting for authentication endpoints
- Include comprehensive audit logging
- Support refresh token rotation

## Implementation Details
```typescript
interface AuthConfig {
  providers: [GitHubProvider];
  session: {
    strategy: 'jwt';
    maxAge: 30 * 24 * 60 * 60; // 30 days
  };
  callbacks: {
    jwt: JWTCallback;
    session: SessionCallback;
  };
}

interface UserSession {
  user: {
    id: string;
    name: string;
    email: string;
    image: string;
    github_username: string;
  };
  accessToken: string;
  refreshToken: string;
  expiresAt: number;
}
```

## Authentication Flow
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant User as User
    participant WebApp as Web App
    participant GitHub as GitHub OAuth
    participant API as Backend API

    User->>WebApp: Click "Login with GitHub"
    WebApp->>GitHub: Redirect to OAuth authorization
    User->>GitHub: Approve permissions
    GitHub->>WebApp: Return authorization code
    WebApp->>GitHub: Exchange code for access token
    GitHub->>WebApp: Return access token + refresh token
    WebApp->>API: Store user session and tokens
    API->>WebApp: Return session cookie
    WebApp->>User: Authenticated dashboard
```

## Security Features
- [ ] **CSRF Protection**: Anti-CSRF tokens for all authentication requests
- [ ] **Secure Cookies**: httpOnly, secure, sameSite cookie attributes
- [ ] **Token Encryption**: Encrypt stored tokens using AES-256
- [ ] **Session Validation**: Validate sessions on every protected request
- [ ] **Audit Logging**: Log all authentication events and token usage

## GitHub Integration
- **Required Scopes**: `read:user`, `user:email`, `repo`
- **Optional Scopes**: `notifications`, `read:org` (for organization repositories)
- **API Access**: Use access token for GitHub API calls
- **Rate Limiting**: Respect GitHub API rate limits with exponential backoff

## Token Management
```typescript
interface TokenManager {
  storeTokens: (userId: string, tokens: Tokens) => Promise<void>;
  refreshToken: (userId: string) => Promise<Tokens>;
  revokeToken: (userId: string) => Promise<void>;
  isTokenValid: (token: string) => Promise<boolean>;
  getAccessToken: (userId: string) => Promise<string>;
}

interface Tokens {
  accessToken: string;
  refreshToken: string;
  expiresAt: number;
  scope: string[];
}
```

## Session Management
- **Session Duration**: 30-day sliding window with activity-based extension
- **Session Storage**: Secure server-side session storage with Redis
- **Cross-tab Sync**: Synchronize authentication state across browser tabs
- **Remember Me**: Optional extended session duration
- **Device Management**: Track and manage user devices and sessions

## Error Handling
- **OAuth Errors**: Handle authorization denied, invalid state, and other OAuth errors
- **Token Expiry**: Automatic token refresh with fallback to re-authentication
- **Network Issues**: Retry logic for authentication requests
- **Invalid Sessions**: Clear invalid sessions and prompt re-authentication

## User Experience
- [ ] **Loading States**: Show loading indicators during authentication flow
- [ ] **Error Messages**: Clear, actionable error messages for authentication failures
- [ ] **Redirect Handling**: Seamless redirects with preserved intended destination
- [ ] **Mobile Support**: Touch-friendly authentication on mobile devices

## API Endpoints
```typescript
// Authentication API endpoints
POST /api/auth/signin      // Initiate GitHub OAuth flow
GET  /api/auth/callback    // Handle OAuth callback
POST /api/auth/signout     // Sign out and revoke tokens
GET  /api/auth/session     // Get current session status
POST /api/auth/refresh     // Refresh access token
```

## Testing Strategy
- [ ] **Unit Tests**: Test authentication components and token management
- [ ] **Integration Tests**: Test complete OAuth flow with mock GitHub responses
- [ ] **Security Tests**: Test CSRF protection and session security
- [ ] **E2E Tests**: Test authentication flow in real browser environment

## Performance Considerations
- **Token Caching**: Cache valid tokens to reduce GitHub API calls
- **Session Lookup**: Optimize session retrieval with efficient data structures
- **Database Indexing**: Index user sessions for fast lookup
- **CDN Integration**: Cache static authentication assets

## Privacy & Compliance
- [ ] **Data Minimization**: Request only necessary GitHub permissions
- [ ] **Token Encryption**: Encrypt all stored tokens and sensitive data
- [ ] **Audit Trail**: Complete audit log of authentication events
- [ ] **GDPR Compliance**: User data deletion and privacy controls

## Monitoring & Analytics
- [ ] **Authentication Metrics**: Track login success/failure rates
- [ ] **Token Usage**: Monitor token refresh patterns and failures
- [ ] **Security Events**: Alert on suspicious authentication activity
- [ ] **Performance**: Monitor authentication flow performance

## Dependencies
- NextAuth.js for authentication framework
- GitHub OAuth App registration
- Redis for session storage
- JWT library for token handling
- Encryption library for token security

## Configuration
```env
# Environment variables
GITHUB_CLIENT_ID=your_github_app_id
GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET=your_github_app_secret
NEXTAUTH_URL=https://your-domain.com
NEXTAUTH_SECRET=your-secret-key
REDIS_URL=redis://localhost:6379
```

## Estimated Effort
- **Story Points**: 8
- **Time Estimate**: 6-8 hours
- **Priority**: P0-critical
- **Sprint**: Week 1

## Definition of Done
- [ ] GitHub OAuth flow is fully functional
- [ ] Token management and refresh working correctly
- [ ] Session persistence across browser restarts
- [ ] Security audit passed
- [ ] All authentication tests passing
- [ ] Documentation updated with setup instructions

issue.body:
## User Story
As a system architect, I want a unified API gateway that handles authentication, rate limiting, and request routing so that all Claude Code platforms can interact securely and efficiently.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] **API Gateway**: Centralized gateway routing requests to appropriate services
- [ ] **Authentication**: JWT-based authentication with token refresh capabilities
- [ ] **Rate Limiting**: Per-user and per-endpoint rate limiting with different tiers
- [ ] **Request Routing**: Intelligent routing based on API version and client type
- [ ] **Load Balancing**: Distribute load across multiple backend instances
- [ ] **Monitoring**: Comprehensive API metrics and health monitoring
- [ ] **Documentation**: Auto-generated OpenAPI documentation with examples

## Technical Architecture
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Web App] --> B[API Gateway]
    C[Mobile App] --> B
    D[CLI Tool] --> B
    B --> E[Auth Service]
    B --> F[Claude Service]
    B --> G[GitHub Service]
    B --> H[File Service]
    B --> I[WebSocket Service]
    E --> J[User Database]
    F --> K[Claude API]
    G --> L[GitHub API]
```

## API Gateway Implementation
```typescript
interface APIGateway {
  authenticate: (token: string) => Promise<User>;
  rateLimit: (userId: string, endpoint: string) => Promise<boolean>;
  routeRequest: (request: APIRequest) => Promise<APIResponse>;
  logRequest: (request: APIRequest, response: APIResponse) => void;
  healthCheck: () => Promise<HealthStatus>;
}

interface APIRequest {
  method: string;
  path: string;
  headers: Record<string, string>;
  body?: any;
  user?: User;
  clientType: 'web' | 'mobile' | 'cli';
}
```

## Core Services

### Authentication Service
- **JWT Management**: Issue, validate, and refresh JWT tokens
- **Session Management**: Maintain user sessions with Redis
- **OAuth Integration**: GitHub OAuth with token management
- **Permission System**: Role-based access control

### Claude Integration Service
- **API Abstraction**: Wrapper around Claude API with retry logic
- **Context Management**: Maintain conversation context and history
- **Token Optimization**: Minimize token usage with smart context truncation
- **Response Caching**: Cache common responses to reduce API calls

### GitHub Integration Service
- **Repository Access**: Fetch repository structure and file contents
- **File Operations**: Create, update, delete files through GitHub API
- **Webhook Handling**: Process GitHub webhooks for real-time updates
- **Branch Management**: Switch between repository branches

### File Management Service
- **File Storage**: Secure storage for user files and temporary data
- **Version Control**: Track file changes and provide rollback capability
- **Sync Service**: Synchronize files across multiple clients
- **Search Service**: Full-text search across user files and repositories

## Rate Limiting Strategy
```typescript
interface RateLimitConfig {
  free_tier: {
    requests_per_minute: 60;
    claude_requests_per_hour: 20;
    file_operations_per_minute: 30;
  };
  pro_tier: {
    requests_per_minute: 300;
    claude_requests_per_hour: 200;
    file_operations_per_minute: 150;
  };
  enterprise_tier: {
    requests_per_minute: 1000;
    claude_requests_per_hour: 1000;
    file_operations_per_minute: 500;
  };
}
```

## Rate Limiting Implementation
- **Redis-based**: Use Redis for distributed rate limiting
- **Sliding Window**: Implement sliding window algorithm for smooth limiting
- **Graceful Degradation**: Return 429 status with retry-after headers
- **Burst Handling**: Allow short bursts above normal limits

## API Endpoints

### Authentication Endpoints
```typescript
POST /api/v1/auth/login          // GitHub OAuth login
POST /api/v1/auth/refresh        // Refresh JWT token
POST /api/v1/auth/logout         // Logout and revoke tokens
GET  /api/v1/auth/me            // Get current user info
```

### Claude Endpoints
```typescript
POST /api/v1/claude/chat         // Send message to Claude
GET  /api/v1/claude/conversations // List user conversations
POST /api/v1/claude/analyze      // Analyze code with Claude
GET  /api/v1/claude/usage        // Get Claude API usage stats
```

### GitHub Endpoints
```typescript
GET  /api/v1/github/repos        // List user repositories
GET  /api/v1/github/tree/:repo   // Get repository file tree
GET  /api/v1/github/file/:repo/:path // Get file content
POST /api/v1/github/file/:repo/:path // Create/update file
```

### File Endpoints
```typescript
POST /api/v1/files/upload        // Upload file
GET  /api/v1/files/:id          // Download file
PUT  /api/v1/files/:id          // Update file
DELETE /api/v1/files/:id        // Delete file
GET  /api/v1/files/search       // Search files
```

## Security Implementation
- [ ] **Input Validation**: Comprehensive input validation and sanitization
- [ ] **SQL Injection Protection**: Parameterized queries and ORM usage
- [ ] **XSS Protection**: Content Security Policy and output encoding
- [ ] **CORS Configuration**: Proper CORS headers for web client access
- [ ] **API Key Security**: Secure storage and transmission of API keys

## Monitoring & Observability
```typescript
interface APIMetrics {
  request_count: number;
  response_time_p95: number;
  error_rate: number;
  rate_limit_hits: number;
  claude_api_usage: number;
  github_api_usage: number;
  active_users: number;
}
```

## Performance Requirements
- [ ] **Response Time**: <200ms for authentication, <500ms for data operations
- [ ] **Throughput**: Handle 1000+ concurrent requests
- [ ] **Availability**: 99.9% uptime with proper failover
- [ ] **Scalability**: Horizontal scaling with load balancers

## Error Handling
```typescript
interface APIError {
  code: string;
  message: string;
  details?: any;
  timestamp: string;
  request_id: string;
}

// Standard error codes
const ErrorCodes = {
  UNAUTHORIZED: 'UNAUTHORIZED',
  RATE_LIMITED: 'RATE_LIMITED',
  INVALID_INPUT: 'INVALID_INPUT',
  SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE: 'SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE',
  INTERNAL_ERROR: 'INTERNAL_ERROR'
};
```

## Testing Strategy
- [ ] **Unit Tests**: Test all API endpoints and business logic
- [ ] **Integration Tests**: Test service interactions and data flow
- [ ] **Load Tests**: Verify performance under high load
- [ ] **Security Tests**: Penetration testing and vulnerability scanning
- [ ] **Contract Tests**: API contract testing between services

## Documentation
- **OpenAPI Specification**: Complete API documentation with examples
- **Client SDKs**: Generated SDKs for web, mobile, and CLI clients
- **Developer Guide**: Integration guide with code examples
- **API Reference**: Comprehensive endpoint documentation

## Deployment Configuration
```yaml
# docker-compose.yml
services:
  api-gateway:
    image: claude-code/api-gateway
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      - REDIS_URL=${REDIS_URL}
      - JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET}
      - CLAUDE_API_KEY=${CLAUDE_API_KEY}
    depends_on:
      - redis
      - postgres
```

## Estimated Effort
- **Story Points**: 20
- **Time Estimate**: 15-18 hours
- **Priority**: P0-critical
- **Sprint**: Week 1-2

## Definition of Done
- [ ] API gateway fully functional with all core endpoints
- [ ] Authentication and rate limiting working correctly
- [ ] All services properly integrated and tested
- [ ] Performance requirements met under load
- [ ] Security audit passed
- [ ] Documentation complete with examples

issue.title: ðŸ  Google Home + Wearable Integration for Watch Nudges & Biometric Data
issue.body:
## Feature Request: Wearable & Smart Home Integration

**Problem:** 
User wants nudges delivered directly to their watch and wants to feed biometric/activity data from wearables into the ADHD system for better context awareness.

**Solution:**
Integrate with Google Home ecosystem and wearable devices to:

### 1. Watch Nudges ðŸ•
- Deliver nudges to smartwatch/fitness tracker via Google Assistant
- Support gentle vibrations, custom watch faces with reminders
- Voice nudges through watch speakers
- Integration with Wear OS or Apple Watch

### 2. Biometric Data Input ðŸ“Š
- Heart rate monitoring for hyperfocus detection
- Activity levels for energy pattern analysis
- Sleep data for cognitive load optimization  
- Step count/movement for break reminders

### 3. Smart Home Context ðŸ 
- Room presence detection for location-aware nudges
- Environmental sensors (light, noise) for focus optimization
- Smart device control (lighting, music) based on ADHD states
- Calendar integration with room booking systems

### Technical Implementation:

#### Phase 1: Google Home Assistant Integration
- [ ] Create Google Assistant Action for MCP ADHD Server
- [ ] Voice command interface ("Hey Google, check my focus status")
- [ ] Smart display notifications for visual nudges
- [ ] Integration with Google Calendar for proactive planning

#### Phase 2: Wearable Integration  
- [ ] Google Fit API integration for activity/health data
- [ ] Wear OS companion app for nudge delivery
- [ ] Apple HealthKit integration (iOS users)
- [ ] Custom watch face with ADHD-specific metrics

#### Phase 3: Advanced Biometric Analysis
- [ ] Heart rate variability analysis for stress detection
- [ ] Movement patterns for hyperfocus identification
- [ ] Sleep quality correlation with productivity patterns
- [ ] Circadian rhythm optimization for nudge timing

#### Phase 4: Environmental Context
- [ ] Home Assistant integration for room-based context
- [ ] Smart lighting control based on focus states
- [ ] Noise level monitoring for distraction management
- [ ] Temperature/air quality correlation with cognitive performance

### API Endpoints to Add:
```
POST /api/integrations/google-home/webhook
POST /api/integrations/wearables/data
GET /api/integrations/biometrics/insights
POST /api/nudges/watch
```

### Configuration:
- Add Google Assistant credentials to .env
- Wearable device pairing flow in onboarding
- Privacy controls for biometric data sharing
- Custom nudge delivery preferences per device

### User Stories:
- **As an ADHD user**, I want my watch to buzz gently when I've been hyperfocused for too long
- **As an ADHD user**, I want the system to know my heart rate is elevated and adjust nudge intensity
- **As an ADHD user**, I want my smart home to create optimal focus environments automatically
- **As an ADHD user**, I want voice commands to quickly update my task status

### Priority: High
This addresses a core user need for seamless, context-aware nudging across all devices.

**Estimated Effort:** 2-3 weeks
**Dependencies:** Google APIs, wearable SDKs, Home Assistant setup

issue.title: ðŸ“§ Gmail Integration for Email-Based ADHD Support
issue.body:
## Feature Request: Gmail Integration

**Problem:** 
ADHD users often struggle with email management - forgetting to respond, getting overwhelmed by inbox clutter, losing important emails, and procrastinating on email tasks.

**Solution:**
Deep Gmail integration to provide ADHD-specific email support and context awareness.

### 1. Email Context Integration ðŸ“¬
- Import calendar events from Gmail automatically
- Extract task mentions from emails ("can you send me...", "please review...")
- Identify urgent emails based on sender, keywords, subject patterns
- Track email response times and patterns

### 2. ADHD-Optimized Email Management ðŸ§ 
- **Inbox Zero Support**: Gentle nudges to process emails regularly
- **Response Reminders**: Smart follow-ups for unreplied important emails
- **Email Batching**: Schedule email checking times to reduce interruptions
- **Priority Filtering**: Surface truly important emails during focus sessions

### 3. Smart Email Actions ðŸ¤–
- Auto-draft responses for common email types
- Schedule emails to be sent at optimal times
- Create calendar events from email content automatically
- Convert emails to tasks in the ADHD system

### 4. Email-Based Nudges ðŸ“¬
- Daily email digest with ADHD-friendly summaries
- Weekly email productivity reports
- Gentle reminders for emails sitting too long
- Celebration emails for inbox maintenance

### Technical Implementation:

#### Phase 1: Basic Gmail API Integration
- [ ] Gmail API authentication and scopes
- [ ] Read email metadata (sender, subject, date, labels)
- [ ] Basic email search and filtering
- [ ] Email thread tracking

#### Phase 2: Content Analysis
- [ ] Extract actionable items from email content
- [ ] Identify meeting requests and calendar events
- [ ] Parse contact information and relationships
- [ ] Detect urgency and importance signals

#### Phase 3: ADHD-Specific Features
- [ ] Response time analysis and nudging
- [ ] Email processing workflow suggestions
- [ ] Interrupt protection during focus time
- [ ] Batch processing recommendations

#### Phase 4: Smart Automation
- [ ] Auto-categorization of emails
- [ ] Smart reply suggestions
- [ ] Email scheduling optimization
- [ ] Integration with task management

### API Endpoints:
```
POST /api/integrations/gmail/webhook       # Gmail push notifications
GET /api/integrations/gmail/inbox          # Get processed inbox
POST /api/integrations/gmail/actions       # Perform email actions
GET /api/integrations/gmail/insights       # Email behavior analytics
POST /api/integrations/gmail/batch-process # Process emails in batches
```

### Configuration:
- Gmail API credentials and OAuth setup
- User permission scopes (read, send, modify)
- Email processing preferences
- Nudge timing for email reminders
- Privacy controls for email content analysis

### User Stories:
- **As an ADHD user**, I want to be reminded to check email only 2-3 times per day
- **As an ADHD user**, I want important emails highlighted automatically  
- **As an ADHD user**, I want emails converted to tasks so I don't forget them
- **As an ADHD user**, I want to batch process emails during designated times
- **As an ADHD user**, I want email response templates for common situations

### ADHD Benefits:
1. **Reduced Email Anxiety**: Structured approach to email management
2. **Better Response Times**: Automated reminders and prioritization
3. **Less Context Switching**: Batched email processing
4. **Task Integration**: Emails become actionable items
5. **Productivity Insights**: Understanding email patterns and improving them

### Privacy & Security:
- OAuth 2.0 with minimal necessary scopes
- Local processing of email content when possible
- User controls for data retention
- Secure storage of email metadata
- Option to disable content analysis

### Priority: High
Email overwhelm is a major ADHD pain point that this integration directly addresses.

**Estimated Effort:** 2-3 weeks
**Dependencies:** Gmail API, OAuth 2.0, email parsing libraries

issue.title: ðŸ”Œ Implement Model Context Protocol (MCP) Client for Universal Tool Integration
issue.body:
## Feature Request: Model Context Protocol Client Implementation

**Problem:** 
The current system has limited integration capabilities with external tools and services. We need a standardized way to connect with various systems, APIs, and tools to expand the ADHD server's capabilities.

**Solution:**
Implement a Model Context Protocol (MCP) client to enable seamless integration with:

### 1. Core MCP Client Features ðŸ”Œ
- MCP protocol specification compliance
- Tool discovery and registration
- Resource management and access control
- Secure tool invocation with rate limiting
- Tool result caching and optimization

### 2. Integration Categories ðŸ› ï¸
- **Productivity Tools**: Notion, Todoist, Trello, Asana
- **Communication**: Slack, Discord, Email APIs
- **Calendar Systems**: Google Calendar, Outlook, Apple Calendar
- **Code Repositories**: GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket
- **Note-taking**: Obsidian, Roam Research, Logseq
- **File Systems**: Google Drive, Dropbox, OneDrive
- **Time Tracking**: Toggl, RescueTime, Clockify
- **Health APIs**: Google Fit, Apple Health, MyFitnessPal

### 3. ADHD-Specific Tool Integrations ðŸ§ 
- **Focus Apps**: Forest, Brain.fm, Focus Keeper
- **Habit Trackers**: Habitica, Streaks, Way of Life
- **Meditation Apps**: Headspace, Calm, Insight Timer
- **Sleep Tracking**: Sleep Cycle, Oura Ring, Fitbit
- **Pomodoro Tools**: Be Focused, Focus Booster

### Technical Implementation:

#### Phase 1: MCP Client Foundation
- [ ] Implement MCP protocol client library
- [ ] Tool registry and lifecycle management
- [ ] Authentication and authorization framework
- [ ] Error handling and retry mechanisms

#### Phase 2: Core Integrations
- [ ] Google Workspace (Calendar, Drive, Gmail)
- [ ] GitHub integration for project tracking
- [ ] Notion/Obsidian for knowledge management
- [ ] Todoist/Any.do for task management

#### Phase 3: ADHD-Specific Tools
- [ ] Focus tracking applications
- [ ] Habit and mood tracking
- [ ] Pomodoro and time-blocking tools
- [ ] Biometric and health data sources

#### Phase 4: Advanced Orchestration
- [ ] Multi-tool workflows
- [ ] Conditional tool chaining
- [ ] Context-aware tool selection
- [ ] Performance monitoring and optimization

### Architecture:

```python
class MCPClient:
    """Model Context Protocol client for universal tool integration."""
    
    def register_tool(self, tool_config: ToolConfig) -> bool
    def invoke_tool(self, tool_id: str, params: Dict) -> ToolResult
    def discover_tools(self, category: str) -> List[Tool]
    def manage_resources(self, tool_id: str) -> ResourceManager
```

### API Endpoints to Add:
```
GET /api/mcp/tools                    # List available tools
POST /api/mcp/tools/register          # Register new tool
POST /api/mcp/tools/{tool_id}/invoke  # Invoke specific tool
GET /api/mcp/integrations            # List active integrations
POST /api/mcp/workflows              # Create tool workflows
```

### Configuration:
- Tool-specific API credentials in .env
- User permission management for tool access
- Integration-specific rate limiting
- Tool result caching policies

### User Stories:
- **As an ADHD user**, I want my task management to sync across all my apps
- **As an ADHD user**, I want calendar events to automatically create focus blocks
- **As an ADHD user**, I want my habit tracking to influence nudge timing
- **As an ADHD user**, I want code commits to count toward productivity metrics
- **As an ADHD user**, I want Slack messages to be summarized during focus time

### Benefits:
1. **Universal Integration**: Connect with any MCP-compatible tool
2. **ADHD Context Propagation**: Share context across all integrated tools
3. **Workflow Automation**: Chain tools together for complex ADHD workflows
4. **Reduced Cognitive Load**: Fewer apps to manage, unified interface
5. **Extensibility**: Easy to add new tools without core system changes

### Security Considerations:
- OAuth 2.0 for secure tool authentication
- Scoped permissions per tool integration
- Data encryption for sensitive tool data
- Audit logging for all tool invocations
- User consent for data sharing between tools

### Priority: Medium-High
This enables the system to become a true ADHD productivity hub by connecting with users' existing tool ecosystems.

**Estimated Effort:** 3-4 weeks
**Dependencies:** MCP specification, OAuth libraries, tool-specific SDKs

### Related Issues:
- Connects with #22 (Google Home integration)
- Enables future calendar sync features
- Supports advanced productivity workflows

issue.title: Implement Production CI/CD Pipeline with GitHub Actions

milestone.title: Week 2-3 - Mobile App Launch
milestone.description: Mobile application development and app store submission

issue.body:
## User Story
As a DevOps engineer, I want an automated CI/CD pipeline that builds, tests, and deploys Claude Code applications with zero downtime so that we can ship features rapidly and reliably.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] **Multi-Platform Builds**: Automated builds for web, mobile (iOS/Android), and API services
- [ ] **Automated Testing**: Run full test suite including unit, integration, and E2E tests
- [ ] **Security Scanning**: Automated vulnerability scanning and dependency checks
- [ ] **Multi-Environment**: Deploy to staging automatically, production with approval
- [ ] **Zero Downtime**: Blue-green deployment with automatic rollback on failure
- [ ] **Monitoring Integration**: Deploy health checks and monitoring configuration
- [ ] **Mobile Deployment**: Automated app store builds and submission preparation

## Pipeline Architecture
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Code Push] --> B[GitHub Actions Trigger]
    B --> C[Multi-Platform Build]
    C --> D[Run Test Suite]
    D --> E[Security Scan]
    E --> F[Build Docker Images]
    F --> G[Deploy to Staging]
    G --> H[Integration Tests]
    H --> I{Manual Approval}
    I -->|Approved| J[Production Deploy]
    I -->|Rejected| K[Stop Pipeline]
    J --> L[Health Checks]
    L --> M{Health OK?}
    M -->|Yes| N[Complete]
    M -->|No| O[Auto Rollback]
```

## GitHub Actions Workflows

### Main Deployment Pipeline
```yaml
name: Production Deployment
on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        node-version: [18, 20]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ matrix.node-version }}
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
      - name: Run tests
        run: npm run test:ci
      - name: Run E2E tests
        run: npm run test:e2e
```

### Mobile Build Pipeline
```yaml
name: Mobile App Build
on:
  push:
    branches: [main, develop]
    paths: ['mobile-app/**']

jobs:
  build-ios:
    runs-on: macos-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Setup Xcode
        uses: maxim-lobanov/setup-xcode@v1
        with:
          xcode-version: latest-stable
      - name: Build iOS app
        run: |
          cd mobile-app/ios
          xcodebuild -workspace ClaudeCode.xcworkspace -scheme ClaudeCode -configuration Release
```

## Build Stages

### 1. Code Quality & Testing (15 minutes)
- **Linting**: ESLint, Prettier, TypeScript checks
- **Unit Tests**: Jest with coverage reporting (>80%)
- **Integration Tests**: API and component integration tests
- **Security Scan**: CodeQL, Snyk vulnerability scanning
- **Performance Tests**: Lighthouse CI for web performance

### 2. Multi-Platform Builds (20 minutes)
- **Web App**: Next.js production build with optimization
- **API Services**: Docker multi-stage builds with security scanning
- **Mobile Apps**: iOS and Android builds with code signing
- **Documentation**: Auto-generated API docs and guides

### 3. Staging Deployment (10 minutes)
- **Infrastructure**: Terraform apply for staging environment
- **Database Migrations**: Automated schema updates with rollback
- **Service Deployment**: Blue-green deployment with health checks
- **Integration Testing**: Automated tests against staging environment

### 4. Production Deployment (15 minutes)
- **Manual Approval**: Required approval from team leads
- **Production Deploy**: Zero-downtime blue-green deployment
- **Health Monitoring**: Automated health checks and metrics validation
- **Rollback**: Automatic rollback on failure detection

## Security Integration
```typescript
interface SecurityScans {
  dependency_check: {
    tool: 'Snyk' | 'npm audit';
    fail_on: 'high' | 'critical';
    exclude: string[];
  };
  static_analysis: {
    tool: 'CodeQL' | 'SonarQube';
    languages: ['javascript', 'typescript', 'python'];
    rules: 'security-extended';
  };
  container_scan: {
    tool: 'Trivy' | 'Clair';
    severity_threshold: 'HIGH';
    ignore_unfixed: boolean;
  };
}
```

## Environment Management
```yaml
# environments/staging.yml
environment:
  name: staging
  url: https://staging.claude-code.com
  protection_rules:
    required_reviewers: 1
    wait_timer: 0

# environments/production.yml
environment:
  name: production
  url: https://claude-code.com
  protection_rules:
    required_reviewers: 2
    wait_timer: 5
```

## Deployment Strategies

### Web Application
- **Platform**: Vercel with GitHub integration
- **Strategy**: Atomic deployments with instant rollback
- **CDN**: Automatic cache invalidation and purging
- **Monitoring**: Real-time performance and error monitoring

### API Services
- **Platform**: Railway or AWS ECS with load balancing
- **Strategy**: Blue-green deployment with health checks
- **Database**: Automated migrations with rollback capability
- **Scaling**: Horizontal auto-scaling based on CPU/memory usage

### Mobile Applications
- **iOS**: Automated build with TestFlight distribution
- **Android**: Google Play internal testing track
- **Code Push**: Over-the-air updates for React Native
- **Store Submission**: Automated store asset generation

## Quality Gates
```typescript
interface QualityGates {
  test_coverage: {
    minimum: 80;
    fail_build: true;
  };
  performance: {
    lighthouse_score: 90;
    bundle_size_limit: '500KB';
  };
  security: {
    max_vulnerabilities: 0;
    severity_threshold: 'HIGH';
  };
}
```

## Monitoring & Alerting
- **Build Status**: Slack notifications for build failures
- **Deployment Status**: Teams notifications for deployment events
- **Performance Alerts**: Automated alerts for performance degradation
- **Error Tracking**: Integration with Sentry for error monitoring

## Rollback Strategy
```typescript
interface RollbackPlan {
  trigger_conditions: [
    'health_check_failure',
    'error_rate_spike',
    'manual_trigger'
  ];
  rollback_steps: [
    'stop_new_traffic',
    'switch_to_previous_version',
    'verify_health',
    'notify_team'
  ];
  rollback_time: '< 2 minutes';
}
```

## Cache Management
- **CDN Cache**: Automatic cache invalidation on deployment
- **Application Cache**: Redis cache warming and invalidation
- **Browser Cache**: Cache-busting for static assets
- **API Cache**: Intelligent cache invalidation for API responses

## Performance Optimization
- [ ] **Parallel Builds**: Run builds in parallel where possible
- [ ] **Caching**: Aggressive caching of dependencies and build artifacts
- [ ] **Incremental Builds**: Only rebuild changed components
- [ ] **Resource Optimization**: Efficient resource allocation for builds

## Secrets Management
```yaml
# GitHub Secrets Configuration
secrets:
  CLAUDE_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.CLAUDE_API_KEY }}
  GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
  DOCKER_REGISTRY_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_REGISTRY_TOKEN }}
  VERCEL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
  RAILWAY_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.RAILWAY_TOKEN }}
  IOS_CERTIFICATE: ${{ secrets.IOS_CERTIFICATE }}
  ANDROID_KEYSTORE: ${{ secrets.ANDROID_KEYSTORE }}
```

## Estimated Effort
- **Story Points**: 16
- **Time Estimate**: 12-15 hours
- **Priority**: P1-high
- **Sprint**: Week 2

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Complete CI/CD pipeline operational for all platforms
- [ ] Automated testing and security scanning working
- [ ] Zero-downtime deployment verified
- [ ] Rollback procedures tested and functional
- [ ] Monitoring and alerting configured
- [ ] Documentation complete with runbooks

issue.title: Build Unified API Gateway with Rate Limiting & Authentication

labels.name: P0-critical
labels.description: Critical priority - must complete in Week 1

milestone.title: Week 1 - Web Production Launch
milestone.description: Critical path for web application production deployment

issue.body:
## User Story
As a system architect, I want a unified API gateway that handles authentication, rate limiting, and request routing so that all Claude Code platforms can interact securely and efficiently.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] **API Gateway**: Centralized gateway routing requests to appropriate services
- [ ] **Authentication**: JWT-based authentication with token refresh capabilities
- [ ] **Rate Limiting**: Per-user and per-endpoint rate limiting with different tiers
- [ ] **Request Routing**: Intelligent routing based on API version and client type
- [ ] **Load Balancing**: Distribute load across multiple backend instances
- [ ] **Monitoring**: Comprehensive API metrics and health monitoring
- [ ] **Documentation**: Auto-generated OpenAPI documentation with examples

## Technical Architecture
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Web App] --> B[API Gateway]
    C[Mobile App] --> B
    D[CLI Tool] --> B
    B --> E[Auth Service]
    B --> F[Claude Service]
    B --> G[GitHub Service]
    B --> H[File Service]
    B --> I[WebSocket Service]
    E --> J[User Database]
    F --> K[Claude API]
    G --> L[GitHub API]
```

## API Gateway Implementation
```typescript
interface APIGateway {
  authenticate: (token: string) => Promise<User>;
  rateLimit: (userId: string, endpoint: string) => Promise<boolean>;
  routeRequest: (request: APIRequest) => Promise<APIResponse>;
  logRequest: (request: APIRequest, response: APIResponse) => void;
  healthCheck: () => Promise<HealthStatus>;
}

interface APIRequest {
  method: string;
  path: string;
  headers: Record<string, string>;
  body?: any;
  user?: User;
  clientType: 'web' | 'mobile' | 'cli';
}
```

## Core Services

### Authentication Service
- **JWT Management**: Issue, validate, and refresh JWT tokens
- **Session Management**: Maintain user sessions with Redis
- **OAuth Integration**: GitHub OAuth with token management
- **Permission System**: Role-based access control

### Claude Integration Service
- **API Abstraction**: Wrapper around Claude API with retry logic
- **Context Management**: Maintain conversation context and history
- **Token Optimization**: Minimize token usage with smart context truncation
- **Response Caching**: Cache common responses to reduce API calls

### GitHub Integration Service
- **Repository Access**: Fetch repository structure and file contents
- **File Operations**: Create, update, delete files through GitHub API
- **Webhook Handling**: Process GitHub webhooks for real-time updates
- **Branch Management**: Switch between repository branches

### File Management Service
- **File Storage**: Secure storage for user files and temporary data
- **Version Control**: Track file changes and provide rollback capability
- **Sync Service**: Synchronize files across multiple clients
- **Search Service**: Full-text search across user files and repositories

## Rate Limiting Strategy
```typescript
interface RateLimitConfig {
  free_tier: {
    requests_per_minute: 60;
    claude_requests_per_hour: 20;
    file_operations_per_minute: 30;
  };
  pro_tier: {
    requests_per_minute: 300;
    claude_requests_per_hour: 200;
    file_operations_per_minute: 150;
  };
  enterprise_tier: {
    requests_per_minute: 1000;
    claude_requests_per_hour: 1000;
    file_operations_per_minute: 500;
  };
}
```

## Rate Limiting Implementation
- **Redis-based**: Use Redis for distributed rate limiting
- **Sliding Window**: Implement sliding window algorithm for smooth limiting
- **Graceful Degradation**: Return 429 status with retry-after headers
- **Burst Handling**: Allow short bursts above normal limits

## API Endpoints

### Authentication Endpoints
```typescript
POST /api/v1/auth/login          // GitHub OAuth login
POST /api/v1/auth/refresh        // Refresh JWT token
POST /api/v1/auth/logout         // Logout and revoke tokens
GET  /api/v1/auth/me            // Get current user info
```

### Claude Endpoints
```typescript
POST /api/v1/claude/chat         // Send message to Claude
GET  /api/v1/claude/conversations // List user conversations
POST /api/v1/claude/analyze      // Analyze code with Claude
GET  /api/v1/claude/usage        // Get Claude API usage stats
```

### GitHub Endpoints
```typescript
GET  /api/v1/github/repos        // List user repositories
GET  /api/v1/github/tree/:repo   // Get repository file tree
GET  /api/v1/github/file/:repo/:path // Get file content
POST /api/v1/github/file/:repo/:path // Create/update file
```

### File Endpoints
```typescript
POST /api/v1/files/upload        // Upload file
GET  /api/v1/files/:id          // Download file
PUT  /api/v1/files/:id          // Update file
DELETE /api/v1/files/:id        // Delete file
GET  /api/v1/files/search       // Search files
```

## Security Implementation
- [ ] **Input Validation**: Comprehensive input validation and sanitization
- [ ] **SQL Injection Protection**: Parameterized queries and ORM usage
- [ ] **XSS Protection**: Content Security Policy and output encoding
- [ ] **CORS Configuration**: Proper CORS headers for web client access
- [ ] **API Key Security**: Secure storage and transmission of API keys

## Monitoring & Observability
```typescript
interface APIMetrics {
  request_count: number;
  response_time_p95: number;
  error_rate: number;
  rate_limit_hits: number;
  claude_api_usage: number;
  github_api_usage: number;
  active_users: number;
}
```

## Performance Requirements
- [ ] **Response Time**: <200ms for authentication, <500ms for data operations
- [ ] **Throughput**: Handle 1000+ concurrent requests
- [ ] **Availability**: 99.9% uptime with proper failover
- [ ] **Scalability**: Horizontal scaling with load balancers

## Error Handling
```typescript
interface APIError {
  code: string;
  message: string;
  details?: any;
  timestamp: string;
  request_id: string;
}

// Standard error codes
const ErrorCodes = {
  UNAUTHORIZED: 'UNAUTHORIZED',
  RATE_LIMITED: 'RATE_LIMITED',
  INVALID_INPUT: 'INVALID_INPUT',
  SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE: 'SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE',
  INTERNAL_ERROR: 'INTERNAL_ERROR'
};
```

## Testing Strategy
- [ ] **Unit Tests**: Test all API endpoints and business logic
- [ ] **Integration Tests**: Test service interactions and data flow
- [ ] **Load Tests**: Verify performance under high load
- [ ] **Security Tests**: Penetration testing and vulnerability scanning
- [ ] **Contract Tests**: API contract testing between services

## Documentation
- **OpenAPI Specification**: Complete API documentation with examples
- **Client SDKs**: Generated SDKs for web, mobile, and CLI clients
- **Developer Guide**: Integration guide with code examples
- **API Reference**: Comprehensive endpoint documentation

## Deployment Configuration
```yaml
# docker-compose.yml
services:
  api-gateway:
    image: claude-code/api-gateway
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      - REDIS_URL=${REDIS_URL}
      - JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET}
      - CLAUDE_API_KEY=${CLAUDE_API_KEY}
    depends_on:
      - redis
      - postgres
```

## Estimated Effort
- **Story Points**: 20
- **Time Estimate**: 15-18 hours
- **Priority**: P0-critical
- **Sprint**: Week 1-2

## Definition of Done
- [ ] API gateway fully functional with all core endpoints
- [ ] Authentication and rate limiting working correctly
- [ ] All services properly integrated and tested
- [ ] Performance requirements met under load
- [ ] Security audit passed
- [ ] Documentation complete with examples

issue.title: Implement Mobile Code Editor with Syntax Highlighting

milestone.title: Week 2-3 - Mobile App Launch
milestone.description: Mobile application development and app store submission

issue.body:
## User Story
As a developer using Claude Code on mobile, I want a touch-optimized code editor so that I can view, edit, and interact with code files efficiently on my mobile device.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] **Touch-Optimized Editor**: Custom code editor designed for mobile touch interactions
- [ ] **Syntax Highlighting**: Support for 20+ programming languages with proper colorization
- [ ] **Gesture Controls**: Pinch-to-zoom, scroll, selection gestures, and text manipulation
- [ ] **Auto-completion**: Basic IntelliSense with context-aware suggestions
- [ ] **Code Folding**: Collapse/expand code blocks for better navigation
- [ ] **Find & Replace**: Search and replace functionality with regex support
- [ ] **Claude Integration**: Send selected code or entire files to Claude for analysis
- [ ] **Diff View**: Side-by-side or unified diff view for Claude suggestions

## Technical Requirements
- Custom implementation or fork of existing mobile code editor
- WebView-based solution with native bridge for performance
- Keyboard handling with toolbar for common programming symbols
- File type detection and appropriate syntax highlighting
- Efficient rendering for large files (>1000 lines)

## Implementation Strategy
```typescript
interface MobileCodeEditor {
  content: string;
  language: string;
  theme: 'light' | 'dark';
  readOnly: boolean;
  showLineNumbers: boolean;
  fontSize: number;
  tabSize: number;
  onChange: (content: string) => void;
  onSelectionChange: (selection: Selection) => void;
  onSendToClaude: (content: string, context?: string) => void;
}
```

## Core Features
- **File Management**: Open, save, create new files with proper encoding
- **Multi-file Tabs**: Tab system for managing multiple open files
- **Smart Keyboard**: Extended keyboard with programming symbols
- **Code Actions**: Quick actions like comment/uncomment, format, indent
- **Bracket Matching**: Highlight matching brackets and auto-pairing
- **Line Numbers**: Toggle-able line numbers with current line highlighting

## Touch Interactions
- [ ] **Text Selection**: Long press and drag for precise text selection
- [ ] **Cursor Movement**: Tap to position cursor with magnifier for precision
- [ ] **Scroll & Zoom**: Smooth scrolling with pinch-to-zoom functionality
- [ ] **Context Menu**: Long press context menu with edit actions
- [ ] **Gestures**: Swipe gestures for undo/redo and navigation
- [ ] **Haptic Feedback**: Subtle vibration feedback for important actions

## Mobile-Specific Optimizations
```typescript
interface TouchHandler {
  onTouchStart: (event: TouchEvent) => void;
  onTouchMove: (event: TouchEvent) => void;
  onTouchEnd: (event: TouchEvent) => void;
  handlePinchZoom: (scale: number) => void;
  handleDoubleTap: (position: Point) => void;
  handleLongPress: (position: Point) => void;
}
```

## Language Support
Priority Languages (Week 2):
- JavaScript/TypeScript
- Python
- Java/Kotlin
- Swift/Objective-C
- Go
- Rust
- HTML/CSS
- Markdown
- JSON/YAML

Extended Languages (Week 3):
- C/C++
- C#
- PHP
- Ruby
- Shell/Bash
- SQL
- Docker
- XML

## Performance Considerations
- [ ] **Lazy Rendering**: Render only visible lines for large files
- [ ] **Memory Management**: Efficient text buffer management
- [ ] **Smooth Scrolling**: 60fps scrolling performance
- [ ] **Fast Syntax Highlighting**: Incremental parsing for real-time highlighting
- [ ] **Debounced Changes**: Throttle change events for performance

## Keyboard Integration
```typescript
interface SmartKeyboard {
  showProgrammingToolbar: boolean;
  toolbarButtons: KeyboardButton[];
  autoCorrection: boolean;
  spellCheck: boolean;
  returnKeyType: 'done' | 'send' | 'search';
}

interface KeyboardButton {
  symbol: string;
  action: 'insert' | 'command';
  longPressOptions?: string[];
}
```

## Toolbar Features
- **Common Symbols**: {}, [], (), <>, "", '', ;, :, =, +, -, *, /, %
- **Indentation**: Tab, Shift+Tab for indent/outdent
- **Navigation**: Arrow keys for precise cursor movement
- **Actions**: Undo, Redo, Copy, Paste, Select All
- **Claude**: Quick button to send selection or file to Claude

## Claude Integration
- **Selection Mode**: Send selected code with surrounding context
- **File Mode**: Send entire file with metadata (filename, language)
- **Context Mode**: Include related files and project structure
- **Diff Application**: Apply Claude suggestions with preview

## Accessibility Features
- [ ] **Screen Reader**: VoiceOver/TalkBack support for code navigation
- [ ] **Dynamic Type**: Respect system font size preferences
- [ ] **High Contrast**: Support for high contrast color schemes
- [ ] **Voice Control**: Voice-to-text for code input and commands
- [ ] **Switch Control**: Support for external switch navigation

## Testing Strategy
- [ ] **Unit Tests**: Test editor components and text manipulation logic
- [ ] **Integration Tests**: Test Claude integration and file operations
- [ ] **Performance Tests**: Measure rendering performance with large files
- [ ] **Accessibility Tests**: VoiceOver and keyboard navigation testing
- [ ] **Device Tests**: Test across different screen sizes and orientations

## Error Handling
- **File Loading Errors**: Graceful handling of corrupted or large files
- **Syntax Errors**: Real-time error detection and highlighting
- **Memory Issues**: Fallback to simple text editor for very large files
- **Network Issues**: Offline editing with sync when connectivity returns

## Security Considerations
- Input sanitization for file content and names
- Secure storage of recently opened files
- Protection against malicious file content
- Safe handling of binary files

## Estimated Effort
- **Story Points**: 18
- **Time Estimate**: 14-16 hours
- **Priority**: P1-high
- **Sprint**: Week 2-3

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Code editor works smoothly on both iOS and Android
- [ ] All gesture controls implemented and responsive
- [ ] Syntax highlighting working for priority languages
- [ ] Claude integration functional for code analysis
- [ ] Performance requirements met with large files
- [ ] Accessibility features implemented and tested

issue.title: ðŸ”’ CSP Policy Violations and Security Header Issues

labels.name: security
labels.description: Related to security vulnerabilities, best practices, and secure coding.

issue.body:
## Problem Description
Multiple Content Security Policy violations and security header implementation issues affecting website security and console cleanliness.

## Current Issues
1. **CSP Inline Script Violations** (3 instances)
   - Refused to execute inline script due to CSP directive violations
   - Hash-based CSP ignoring 'unsafe-inline' directive

2. **Security Header Limitations** 
   - X-Frame-Options cannot be set via meta tag (GitHub Pages limitation)
   - frame-ancestors directive ignored in meta element

3. **Service Worker Registration**
   - 404 error on sw.js file
   - PWA functionality potentially impacted

## Error Details
```
X-Frame-Options may only be set via an HTTP header
Content Security Policy directive 'frame-ancestors' is ignored when delivered via <meta>
Refused to execute inline script because it violates CSP directive
A bad HTTP response code (404) was received when fetching the script
SW registration failed
```

## GitHub Pages Constraints
- Cannot set HTTP-only security headers
- Must use meta tag implementations for CSP
- Limited server-side configuration options

## Proposed Solutions
1. **CSP Optimization**: Update hash values and inline script handling
2. **Service Worker**: Create missing sw.js file or remove registration
3. **Documentation**: Document GitHub Pages security limitations
4. **Alternative Approaches**: Consider netlify/_headers or similar for enhanced security

## Priority
**Medium** - Security improvements important but not breaking core functionality

## Labels
- `security`
- `csp` 
- `pwa`
- `github-pages`

issue.title: Implement GitHub OAuth Authentication & Session Management

labels.name: P0-critical
labels.description: Critical priority - must complete in Week 1

milestone.title: Week 1 - Web Production Launch
milestone.description: Critical path for web application production deployment

issue.body:
## User Story
As a developer, I want secure GitHub authentication so that I can access my repositories and maintain persistent sessions across the Claude Code platform.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] **OAuth Flow**: Complete GitHub OAuth 2.0 integration with proper error handling
- [ ] **Token Management**: Secure storage and refresh of GitHub access tokens
- [ ] **Session Persistence**: Maintain user sessions across browser restarts
- [ ] **Permission Scopes**: Request appropriate GitHub permissions (repos, user)
- [ ] **Multi-account Support**: Support multiple GitHub accounts per user
- [ ] **Security**: Implement CSRF protection and secure token storage
- [ ] **Logout**: Complete logout with token revocation

## Technical Requirements
- Use NextAuth.js for authentication infrastructure
- Implement JWT tokens with secure httpOnly cookies
- Add rate limiting for authentication endpoints
- Include comprehensive audit logging
- Support refresh token rotation

## Implementation Details
```typescript
interface AuthConfig {
  providers: [GitHubProvider];
  session: {
    strategy: 'jwt';
    maxAge: 30 * 24 * 60 * 60; // 30 days
  };
  callbacks: {
    jwt: JWTCallback;
    session: SessionCallback;
  };
}

interface UserSession {
  user: {
    id: string;
    name: string;
    email: string;
    image: string;
    github_username: string;
  };
  accessToken: string;
  refreshToken: string;
  expiresAt: number;
}
```

## Authentication Flow
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant User as User
    participant WebApp as Web App
    participant GitHub as GitHub OAuth
    participant API as Backend API

    User->>WebApp: Click "Login with GitHub"
    WebApp->>GitHub: Redirect to OAuth authorization
    User->>GitHub: Approve permissions
    GitHub->>WebApp: Return authorization code
    WebApp->>GitHub: Exchange code for access token
    GitHub->>WebApp: Return access token + refresh token
    WebApp->>API: Store user session and tokens
    API->>WebApp: Return session cookie
    WebApp->>User: Authenticated dashboard
```

## Security Features
- [ ] **CSRF Protection**: Anti-CSRF tokens for all authentication requests
- [ ] **Secure Cookies**: httpOnly, secure, sameSite cookie attributes
- [ ] **Token Encryption**: Encrypt stored tokens using AES-256
- [ ] **Session Validation**: Validate sessions on every protected request
- [ ] **Audit Logging**: Log all authentication events and token usage

## GitHub Integration
- **Required Scopes**: `read:user`, `user:email`, `repo`
- **Optional Scopes**: `notifications`, `read:org` (for organization repositories)
- **API Access**: Use access token for GitHub API calls
- **Rate Limiting**: Respect GitHub API rate limits with exponential backoff

## Token Management
```typescript
interface TokenManager {
  storeTokens: (userId: string, tokens: Tokens) => Promise<void>;
  refreshToken: (userId: string) => Promise<Tokens>;
  revokeToken: (userId: string) => Promise<void>;
  isTokenValid: (token: string) => Promise<boolean>;
  getAccessToken: (userId: string) => Promise<string>;
}

interface Tokens {
  accessToken: string;
  refreshToken: string;
  expiresAt: number;
  scope: string[];
}
```

## Session Management
- **Session Duration**: 30-day sliding window with activity-based extension
- **Session Storage**: Secure server-side session storage with Redis
- **Cross-tab Sync**: Synchronize authentication state across browser tabs
- **Remember Me**: Optional extended session duration
- **Device Management**: Track and manage user devices and sessions

## Error Handling
- **OAuth Errors**: Handle authorization denied, invalid state, and other OAuth errors
- **Token Expiry**: Automatic token refresh with fallback to re-authentication
- **Network Issues**: Retry logic for authentication requests
- **Invalid Sessions**: Clear invalid sessions and prompt re-authentication

## User Experience
- [ ] **Loading States**: Show loading indicators during authentication flow
- [ ] **Error Messages**: Clear, actionable error messages for authentication failures
- [ ] **Redirect Handling**: Seamless redirects with preserved intended destination
- [ ] **Mobile Support**: Touch-friendly authentication on mobile devices

## API Endpoints
```typescript
// Authentication API endpoints
POST /api/auth/signin      // Initiate GitHub OAuth flow
GET  /api/auth/callback    // Handle OAuth callback
POST /api/auth/signout     // Sign out and revoke tokens
GET  /api/auth/session     // Get current session status
POST /api/auth/refresh     // Refresh access token
```

## Testing Strategy
- [ ] **Unit Tests**: Test authentication components and token management
- [ ] **Integration Tests**: Test complete OAuth flow with mock GitHub responses
- [ ] **Security Tests**: Test CSRF protection and session security
- [ ] **E2E Tests**: Test authentication flow in real browser environment

## Performance Considerations
- **Token Caching**: Cache valid tokens to reduce GitHub API calls
- **Session Lookup**: Optimize session retrieval with efficient data structures
- **Database Indexing**: Index user sessions for fast lookup
- **CDN Integration**: Cache static authentication assets

## Privacy & Compliance
- [ ] **Data Minimization**: Request only necessary GitHub permissions
- [ ] **Token Encryption**: Encrypt all stored tokens and sensitive data
- [ ] **Audit Trail**: Complete audit log of authentication events
- [ ] **GDPR Compliance**: User data deletion and privacy controls

## Monitoring & Analytics
- [ ] **Authentication Metrics**: Track login success/failure rates
- [ ] **Token Usage**: Monitor token refresh patterns and failures
- [ ] **Security Events**: Alert on suspicious authentication activity
- [ ] **Performance**: Monitor authentication flow performance

## Dependencies
- NextAuth.js for authentication framework
- GitHub OAuth App registration
- Redis for session storage
- JWT library for token handling
- Encryption library for token security

## Configuration
```env
# Environment variables
GITHUB_CLIENT_ID=your_github_app_id
GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET=your_github_app_secret
NEXTAUTH_URL=https://your-domain.com
NEXTAUTH_SECRET=your-secret-key
REDIS_URL=redis://localhost:6379
```

## Estimated Effort
- **Story Points**: 8
- **Time Estimate**: 6-8 hours
- **Priority**: P0-critical
- **Sprint**: Week 1

## Definition of Done
- [ ] GitHub OAuth flow is fully functional
- [ ] Token management and refresh working correctly
- [ ] Session persistence across browser restarts
- [ ] Security audit passed
- [ ] All authentication tests passing
- [ ] Documentation updated with setup instructions
