- [ ] **Search**: Global search across projects, files, and conversation history
- [ ] **Responsive Design**: Optimized for desktop, tablet, and mobile browsers
- [ ] **Customization**: Personalized dashboard with draggable widgets

## Technical Requirements
- Use Next.js App Router with server-side rendering
- Implement lazy loading for performance with large project counts
- Add real-time updates using WebSocket integration
- Include accessibility features and keyboard shortcuts
- Support offline mode with cached data

## Implementation Details
```typescript
interface Dashboard {
  projects: Project[];
  recentActivity: Activity[];
  stats: UsageStats;
  quickActions: QuickAction[];
  widgets: Widget[];
  searchResults: SearchResult[];
  loading: boolean;
  error: string | null;
}

interface Project {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  repository: string;
  lastAccessed: Date;
  fileCount: number;
  conversationCount: number;
  status: 'active' | 'archived' | 'error';
}
```

## UI Components
- `DashboardGrid`: Main dashboard layout with responsive grid
- `ProjectCard`: Project summary card with key metrics and quick actions
- `ActivityFeed`: Real-time activity timeline with filtering
- `StatsWidget`: Usage statistics with charts and graphs
- `SearchBar`: Global search with autocomplete and filters
- `QuickActionPanel`: Floating action buttons for common tasks
- `WidgetContainer`: Draggable widget system for customization

## Features
- **Project Management**: Create, archive, and organize projects
- **Activity Tracking**: Monitor file edits, Claude conversations, and system events
- **Usage Analytics**: Track API usage, response times, and productivity metrics
- **Favorites**: Pin frequently used projects and files
- **Notifications**: In-app notifications for important events and updates
- **Export**: Export project data and conversation history

## Performance Requirements
- [ ] **Fast Loading**: Dashboard loads within 1.5 seconds
- [ ] **Smooth Animations**: 60fps animations for interactions and transitions
- [ ] **Efficient Updates**: Real-time updates without full page reloads
- [ ] **Memory Usage**: <100MB memory footprint with 50+ projects

## Data Management
- **Caching Strategy**: Cache project metadata and recent activity locally
- **Pagination**: Lazy load projects and activities with infinite scroll
- **Offline Support**: Show cached data when offline with sync indicators
- **Data Synchronization**: Real-time sync across browser tabs and devices

## Responsive Design
- [ ] **Desktop**: Full dashboard with sidebar and multiple columns
- [ ] **Tablet**: Collapsible sidebar with touch-optimized interactions
- [ ] **Mobile**: Stack layout with bottom navigation and gestures
- [ ] **Accessibility**: Screen reader support and keyboard navigation

## Widget System
```typescript
interface Widget {
  id: string;
  type: 'stats' | 'activity' | 'projects' | 'search' | 'custom';
  position: { x: number; y: number };
  size: { width: number; height: number };
  config: Record<string, any>;
  visible: boolean;
}
```

Available Widgets:
- **Usage Stats**: API usage, token consumption, cost tracking
- **Recent Projects**: Quick access to recently used projects
- **Activity Timeline**: Recent file changes and Claude interactions
- **File Search**: Search across all project files
- **Conversation History**: Recent Claude conversations
- **Performance Metrics**: Response times and system health

## Integration Points
- **GitHub API**: Fetch repository information and metadata
- **Claude API**: Usage statistics and conversation history
- **WebSocket**: Real-time activity updates
- **Analytics**: User behavior tracking (privacy-compliant)

## Security Considerations
- Secure API token storage and transmission
- User data privacy and GDPR compliance
- Input sanitization for search and filters
- Rate limiting for API calls and searches

## Testing Requirements
- [ ] **Unit Tests**: Test all dashboard components and logic
- [ ] **Integration Tests**: Test API integrations and data flow
- [ ] **Performance Tests**: Verify performance with large datasets
- [ ] **Accessibility Tests**: Screen reader and keyboard testing
- [ ] **Mobile Tests**: Touch interactions and responsive behavior

## SEO & Performance
- **Server-side Rendering**: Fast initial page load with Next.js
- **Meta Tags**: Proper meta tags for search engines
- **Core Web Vitals**: Optimize for Google's performance metrics
- **Progressive Enhancement**: Work without JavaScript enabled

## Analytics & Insights
- [ ] **Usage Patterns**: Track how users interact with dashboard features
- [ ] **Performance Monitoring**: Monitor page load times and errors
- [ ] **A/B Testing**: Test different dashboard layouts and features
- [ ] **User Feedback**: Collect feedback on dashboard usability

## Estimated Effort
- **Story Points**: 12
- **Time Estimate**: 9-11 hours
- **Priority**: P0-critical
- **Sprint**: Week 1

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Dashboard is fully functional with all core features
- [ ] Responsive design works on all device sizes
- [ ] Real-time updates working via WebSocket
- [ ] Performance requirements met
- [ ] Accessibility requirements satisfied
- [ ] All tests passing and code reviewed

issue.title: Implement Real-time WebSocket Infrastructure

labels.name: P0-critical
labels.description: Critical priority - must complete in Week 1

milestone.title: Week 1 - Web Production Launch
milestone.description: Critical path for web application production deployment

issue.body:
## User Story
As a developer using Claude Code across multiple devices, I want real-time synchronization so that my work stays consistent across web, mobile, and CLI platforms.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] **WebSocket Server**: Production-ready Socket.IO server with clustering support
- [ ] **Client Integration**: Web client with automatic reconnection and error handling
- [ ] **Message Broadcasting**: Efficient message routing between connected clients
- [ ] **Session Management**: Persistent sessions with authentication and authorization
- [ ] **Connection Scaling**: Support 1000+ concurrent connections per server instance
- [ ] **Message Queuing**: Reliable message delivery with persistence during disconnections
- [ ] **Cross-platform Sync**: Synchronize state between web, mobile, and CLI clients

## Technical Requirements
- Implement Socket.IO v4 with Redis adapter for horizontal scaling
- JWT-based authentication for WebSocket connections
- Message compression and rate limiting
- Connection pooling and load balancing
- Comprehensive logging and monitoring

## Implementation Details
```typescript
interface WebSocketServer {
  io: Server;
  redis: RedisAdapter;
  authenticate: (socket: Socket, token: string) => Promise<User>;
  joinRoom: (socket: Socket, roomId: string) => void;
  broadcast: (event: string, data: any, room?: string) => void;
  handleDisconnection: (socket: Socket) => void;
}

interface MessageTypes {
  'code_change': { fileId: string; content: string; userId: string };
  'claude_response': { conversationId: string; message: string };
  'file_selection': { files: string[]; userId: string };
  'user_presence': { userId: string; status: 'online' | 'away' | 'offline' };
}
```

## Server Components
- `WebSocketServer`: Main server class with Socket.IO configuration
- `AuthenticationMiddleware`: JWT token validation for connections
- `RoomManager`: Manage user rooms and message routing
- `MessageHandler`: Process and validate incoming messages
- `RedisAdapter`: Redis-based clustering and message persistence
- `HealthCheck`: Server health monitoring and metrics

## Client Features
- **Auto-reconnection**: Exponential backoff with connection retry
- **Offline Handling**: Queue messages during disconnection
- **Connection Status**: Visual indicators for connection state
- **Message Acknowledgment**: Ensure reliable message delivery
- **Error Recovery**: Graceful handling of connection errors

## Message Flow
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant WebClient as Web Client
    participant Server as WebSocket Server  
    participant Mobile as Mobile Client
    participant Claude as Claude API

    WebClient->>Server: Connect with JWT
    Server->>WebClient: Authentication Success
    WebClient->>Server: Join Room (projectId)
    Mobile->>Server: Connect and Join Same Room
    
    WebClient->>Server: File Selection Changed
    Server->>Mobile: Broadcast File Selection
    WebClient->>Claude: Send Code for Analysis
    Claude->>Server: Response Ready
    Server->>WebClient: Claude Response
    Server->>Mobile: Claude Response
```

## Performance Requirements
- [ ] **Low Latency**: <100ms message delivery within same region
- [ ] **High Throughput**: Handle 10,000+ messages per second
- [ ] **Memory Efficient**: <50MB memory usage per 1000 connections
- [ ] **CPU Efficient**: <20% CPU usage under normal load
- [ ] **Connection Limits**: Support 1000+ concurrent connections per instance

## Scaling Architecture
- **Horizontal Scaling**: Multiple server instances with Redis clustering
- **Load Balancing**: Sticky sessions with health check endpoints
- **Redis Clustering**: Distributed message persistence and state sharing
- **Auto-scaling**: Container-based scaling based on connection count

## Security Features
- [ ] **Authentication**: JWT-based authentication with token refresh
- [ ] **Authorization**: Room-based access control with user permissions
- [ ] **Rate Limiting**: Per-user and per-IP rate limiting
- [ ] **Input Validation**: Sanitize and validate all incoming messages
- [ ] **DDoS Protection**: Connection limits and abuse detection

## Monitoring & Observability
- [ ] **Connection Metrics**: Track active connections, join/leave rates
- [ ] **Message Metrics**: Monitor message throughput and delivery success
- [ ] **Error Tracking**: Log and alert on connection errors and failures
- [ ] **Performance Metrics**: Response times, memory usage, CPU utilization
- [ ] **Health Checks**: Automated health monitoring with alerting

## Error Handling
- **Connection Failures**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- **Authentication Errors**: Clear error messages and reauthentication flow
- **Message Delivery Failures**: Acknowledgment system with retry logic
- **Server Overload**: Graceful degradation with client notification
- **Network Partitions**: Split-brain detection and recovery

## Testing Strategy
- [ ] **Unit Tests**: Test all server components and message handlers
- [ ] **Integration Tests**: Test client-server communication flows
- [ ] **Load Tests**: Verify performance under high connection counts
- [ ] **Chaos Testing**: Test resilience to network failures and server crashes
- [ ] **Security Tests**: Validate authentication and authorization

## Deployment Configuration
```yaml
# docker-compose.yml
services:
  websocket-server:
    image: claude-code/websocket-server
    ports:
      - "3001:3001"
    environment:
      - REDIS_URL=${REDIS_URL}
      - JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET}
    deploy:
      replicas: 3
      update_config:
        parallelism: 1
        delay: 10s
```

## Dependencies
- Socket.IO server and Redis adapter
- Redis cluster for message persistence
- JWT library for authentication
- Docker for containerization
- NGINX for load balancing

## Estimated Effort
- **Story Points**: 15
- **Time Estimate**: 12-14 hours
- **Priority**: P0-critical
- **Sprint**: Week 1

## Definition of Done
- [ ] WebSocket server deployed and operational
- [ ] All message types implemented and tested
- [ ] Performance requirements verified under load
- [ ] Security audit passed
- [ ] Monitoring and alerting configured
- [ ] Documentation complete with API reference
